Case reference: 2014004801.CaseDesc: Beant Singh Khosa was last seen in Punjab, India on April 15th, 2006.  He travelled to India to attend his father's funeral and never returned.  It is rumored he has returned to Canada, however, his family and friends have not heard from him.

Case reference: 2012020083.CaseDesc: On June 4, 1980, John Roy MacLellan, 79 years old, was last seen in Lintlaw, SK. Mr. MacLellan's medical condition made him, at times, confused. In October of 1980, his vehicle was located in the Usherville district. Searches of that area have failed to locate Mr. MacLellan.

Case reference: 2012020042.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1991, Jennifer Anne Regan was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Chest, Collar bone, according to medical records from 1985
Left Wrist, According to medical records from 1985

Case reference: 2012020662.CaseDesc: Marc April was last seen at approximately 6:30 p.m. on the January 31, 1987, at the Saskatoon City Hospital. Mr. April was a patient at a hospital at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2006022099.CaseDesc: Duane Wicklund and Edward Kotula were last seen on October 7, 1967, in a loaded boat on Sturgeon Lake. They were vacationing in the area and heading to Margaret Resort on Harris Bay. Neither has been seen since and both are presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Nose, from nose to upper lip

Case reference: 2014004940.CaseDesc: On May 24, 2006, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Shemron King was seen for the last time by his father in Toronto, Ontario. When his father returned home, Shemrom and his mother were gone.

Case reference: 2015039943.CaseDesc: A family member reported that they had not seen Clarence Bigeye since 1974.

Case reference: 2014005741.CaseDesc: Joseph Angus Morin had been living in Sturgeon Landing, Saskatchewan but left in December 2011, to take up residence in Wanless, MB. Joseph frequently traveled between the communities in the immediate area and was last seen in Cranberry Portage on or about January 25, 2012.

Case reference: 2006022499.CaseDesc: Witold Sagin was last seen while fishing on Gordon Lake. He was fishing in a canoe, which was later found overturned. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014005240.CaseDesc: Mr.Utinowatum was last seen on April 6, 2002 at 9:00pm in the area of Beaver Ranch, Alberta, near Fort Vermilion. Mr. Utinowatum wandered off from a residence after visiting family in the area.  Mr.Utinowatum has not been seen or heard from since. Mr.Utinowatum suffered from alcohol addiction problems.

Case reference: 2019053661.CaseDesc:
On July 2, 1988, an unidentified man was found in the parking lot of the Value Village
on East Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had suffered from a
heart attack, and the results of his autopsy showed evidence of previous heart damage and a case of mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

Case reference: 2013000136.CaseDesc: Mr. Joseph Moore was last seen on October 31, 2012 by his employer in Kincardine, Ontario.  He was reported missing on November 12, 2012. Upon investigation, M. Moore's apartment was found neat and tidy and his clothing and luggage had been left behind. Joseph Moore is known to suffer from severe cases of depression. The last potential sighting was at the Kincardine Davidson Centre on November 8, 2012.  A media blitz was done to request feedback for missing person Joseph Moore with limited feedback. An extensive search of the area was conducted with negative results.

Case reference: 2014004535.CaseDesc: Jack Fraser was last seen on August 2, 2004 at his place of work in downtown Vancouver. His parents reported him missing as they had not seen or heard from him in over two weeks. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004248.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1979, at approximately 5:00 a.m., Myrna Montgrand was seen for the last time outside of a residence in La Loche, Saskatchewan. Earlier that morning, Myrna had been with a group of people at a party. Searches and investigation have failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2014005899.CaseDesc: Karen Gilbert left her home in Quebec City on October 7, 2012, at some point during the night. She was subsequently dropped off by taxi in the vicinity of the Montmorency Falls. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000103.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1969,  three commercial fishermen sold their catch, purchased groceries and departed Jackpine Island for Brochet via Reindeer Lake. Mr. Bighetty left in his own canoe and was ahead of two other men who were also travelling by canoe. The second canoe later had mechanical problems and had to stop on an island. The two men indicated that they had heard the other canoe and figured it was Mr. Bighetty coming back to look for them. However, they never saw him again. Mr. Bighetty's canoe was located in the lake in a vertical position 9.6 kilometers south of Brochet. It is presumed he drowned and no foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2012020073.CaseDesc: On February 20, 2004, at approximately 11:45 p.m., Sunshine Wood was seen for the last time in front of the St. Regis Hotel, situated on 285 Smith Street, in Winnipeg, Manitoba. That night, Sunshine had been socializing with a number of the hotel’s patrons in front of the hotel. During the time of her disappearance, Sunshine was enrolled at the Gordon Bell High School, and is not known to be a runaway. Her disappearance is out of character.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Image of a heart
Left Hand, Unknown tattoo on all fingers

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2014004068.CaseDesc: Alexandra Sawicki disappeared from her home in Mississauga, Ontario, on November 13, 2000. She was driving a burgundy 1998 Dodge Neon with 4 doors. Mrs. Sawicki drove to Niagara Falls, Ontario and parked her car in the parking lot by the falls, where it was found abandoned by the Police later that evening. Mrs. Sawicki may have been upset and distraught. She speaks fluent English, Romanian and Hungarian.

Scar: Eyes, Right side of the right eye

Case reference: 2021008284.CaseDesc: On December 29, 2020, this young to middle-aged Caucasian woman died in a car accident on Trans-Canada Highway 1 near Chilliwack, BC. She wore blue nail polish and had no tattoos on her lower back, abdomen or legs. She had an upper denture and her lower teeth were in poor condition.

Case reference: 2014004569.CaseDesc: In August 1966, Philomene (Tiger) Lemay was socializing at a local bar in Slave Lake.  She was last seen very intoxicated.  Mrs. Lemay may have left with one or two men, possibly Americans, in the early evening.

Case reference: 2020028767.CaseDesc: In the late evening of August 24, 1975, Jean-Marc Meagher was seen for the last time in Berthierville, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005998.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2013, Joshua Miller was seen for the last time in the downtown area of St. John’s Newfoundland.

Shirt: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Purple shirt with black stripes

Case reference: 2014005815.CaseDesc: On June 18, 2012 at 1630 hours, Regina Police Service received a phone call from Floyd Kakakaway reporting his brother Frederick Kakakaway missing. Floyd advised that the last time he saw Fred was early in the morning on the 14th of June, 2012 at 0600 hours. Fred told Floyd that he was headed to the Regent Park Safeway to look for cans. He hasn't returned home and no one has seen him since. Fred is a diabetic.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , A cross, forks and a heart
Left Upper Arm, Heart and ribbon with Fred
Deformity: Right Leg, Walks with a slight limp

Case reference: 2006028299.CaseDesc: Shawn McConkey was last seen leaving work on December 21, 2001. That same day, his vehicle was involved in a single vehicle collision on County Road #22 in Otonabee-South Monaghan Township. No one was located at the scene of the accident. A search of the area has failed to locate Mr. McConkey and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Shirt: Denim, Blue, Emblem over left pocket and name over right pocket
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Picture of a skull and the word "Tom"
Right Hand, Trees and a cross
Right Upper Arm , Picture of Hitler

Case reference: 2006024099.CaseDesc: David Jennings was last seen on June 13, 1991. He is presumed to have drowned on Blackstone Lake in Archipelago Township.

Jacket: Silk, Blue, across shoulders "Bass Fishing"  picture bass fish

Case reference: 2016061093.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1972, a female was found in Lake Erie, west of the Colchester light, east of the Detroit Channel, near the Town of Colchester, Ontario. Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being 170-180 lbs however, this measurement may not represent her actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. She is believed to have been dead for 1-5 weeks.

Shoes: Brown, Loafers, made in Japan with 4 diamonds shape buttons on top, size 10
Sweater: Black, Dark Blue, Short sleeved, collar and round brass buttons

Case reference: 2014003230.CaseDesc: Mr. James McGrath was reported missing on May 31, 2001, by family members.  At the time of his disappearance he was residing near Patrick's Cove, NL.  Mr. McGrath lived alone, and was last seen walking on the roadway approximately seven days before his disappearance.

Case reference: 2011762660.CaseDesc: Brittany Stalman was last seen on Crawford Drive, Delta, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014001943.CaseDesc: Kam Lee was last seen in the Bishop Grandin and River Road area of Winnipeg, MB.  Mr. Lee's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014002407.CaseDesc: Robert Scott Ellis and a friend headed out fishing on June 27, 1973. They left in the morning around 9:30 am and fished until around 6:00 pm when they decided to return home. During the course of the day, poor weather rolled in and the water became quite rough. They started taking in water over the sides of the canoe. Despite the progress they made, one wave eventually rolled the canoe. Both men hung onto the canoe for hours, but Robert eventually tired and let go.  When the friend eventually reached shore, he reported the incident. Dragging and diving operations were initiated and the results were negative. Mr. Ellis is presumed to have drowned. No foul play is suspected in this case.

Case reference: 2014004021.CaseDesc: On July 10th, 1998, Ronald Oxley was last seen leaving his residence in Thompson Manitoba. He told friends he was going to the bank and then to the grocery store. Mr. Oxley has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Nose, One inch long, left side

Case reference: 2014006086.CaseDesc: Martin Geoffrion was last seen on April 26, 2013 in Montreal. He left his home around 4:00 pm in a Mercedes vehicle. On April 30, 2013, the Mercedes was located in a cul-de-sac in St-Roch de l'Achigan. According to his relatives, Mr. Geoffrion was not suicidal. He loved fishing and playing golf.

Case reference: 2014002692.CaseDesc: Between September 3 and October 3, 1978, Jean-Jacques Sirois was seen for the last time in the Rosemont District in Montreal, Quebec. Jean-Jacques has not been seen or heard from since.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold ring with rectangular cubic zirconia

Case reference: 2012020661.CaseDesc: Darlene Anderson was last seen leaving the Hantleman Building at the Royal University Hospital in Saskatoon on November 6, 2006 at 8:00 pm.

Case reference: 2014007307.CaseDesc: On the 28th of May, 1987, a small shed was moved and a body of what appeared to be a full term infant was found. It had been wrapped in two towels and placed under the shed. Examination of the body was done by the University Of Saskatchewan Department Of Archaeology. It was determined the body was that of a full or part North American Indian and had been there from one to three years. The sex of the infant could not be determined. This case is being investigated by the Office of the Chief Coroner and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2016068411.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1969, the body of a male, believed to be between the ages of 25 to 35 years old, was found on the Lake Erie Country Club beach, Malden Township, Essex County. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was uncircumcised. It is estimated that he had been in the water for 5-7 days prior to discovery.

Teeth: He had an upper denture and he may have worn a lower denture.
Underwear: White, "Fruit of the Loom" brand, size 30

Case reference: 2018053566.CaseDesc: On September 26, 1995, at approximately 8:30am, Robert Walmsley was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Robert was scheduled to meet with his sister the following day, but did not show up.

Case reference: 2012003499.CaseDesc: On January 24, 1983, Tim Maletic left his family residence in Kitchener, Ontario. He left a note saying he was going to Toronto and has not been heard from since. Mr. Maletic also has ties to the Windsor, Ontario area.

Backpack: Blue, Red, Adidas, Blue with red trim

Case reference: 2020050890.CaseDesc: On August 9, 2020, days after the death of her son, Audrey Beaver was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. That day, Audrey had told her family that she planned on setting up a tent to live in.

Case reference: 2016061368.CaseDesc: On April 3, 1985, this unidentified male was found by a construction crew lying under a bridge at Spadina and Lakeshore Blvd. He was then taken to Toronto Western Hospital Emergency Department, where he never regained consciousness and died on April 17, 1985.

Hair: Grey, White, medium length hair; a grey moustache and a two-day old beard

Case reference: 2012020171.CaseDesc: An adult male was found in a forested area of the Scuzzy Log Dump near North Bend. This is on the west side of the Fraser River, across from Boston Bar.

Teeth: Good dental care with some fillings

Case reference: 2012020137.CaseDesc: On Friday September 27, 1963, Diane Carrier went to the neighborhood park in the Old Quebec district of Quebec City, Quebec, to advise her brother to return home for dinner. Her brother came home alone and Diane has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2021047301.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2001, Margarito Perez-Hernandez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2010006399.CaseDesc: Glen Wesley, a patient at the Northeast Mental Health Hospital, was granted permission to leave the facility on his birthday. Staff believe he went to downtown North Bay. Mr. Wesley did not return and was noticed missing at approximately 2:15 PM. He suffers from Schizophrenia which requires medication. Since his disappearance there have been several unconfirmed sightings of Mr. Wesley in the Cochrane, Timmins and New Liskeard areas.

Case reference: 2006010899.CaseDesc: Larry Zink left his home in Delavan, Wisconsin, USA. Family members have indicated that he may have been depressed.  In October 1995, Mr. Zink's vehicle was located unoccupied in a gravel pit 65 km north of Pickle Lake, Ontario.  Mr. Zink has not been seen since.

Teeth: False, Upper teeth and partial bottom teeth - front bottom teeth are his own

Case reference: 2016068159.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1968, the skeletonized remains of what is believed to be a male individual was found on the Georgian Bay shoreline in Culvert's Dump, 6 miles southeast of Tobermory, Bruce County. The appendix was present. It is believed that he had been in the water for no less than 2 years before discovery.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Evidence of tooth extraction; it is possible that this individual wore a partial upper denture.
Pants: Charcoal grey or black synthetic material was recovered from the body at the waist region.
Belt: Leather, size 40; markings on belt read "Top Grain Steerhide Bridle 91299"

Case reference: 2012020084.CaseDesc: Kenneth Kettleson was an avid hunter and outdoorsman, and he led a reclusive lifestyle. Kenneth had not been seen for two weeks before he was reported missing. His residence was secure, and his vehicle was in the yard.

Case reference: 2014003152.CaseDesc: Sylvain Baril was last seen on August 8, 1999, in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2006023099.CaseDesc: Gordon Zeigler was last seen on January 3, 1991, heading to a camp on Elizabeth Lake, Ontario by snowmobile. Although his snowmobile was located on Lake Nipigon, he was never found and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014003364.CaseDesc: On June 27, 1992, Heather Miller was reported missing by her boyfriend. Ms. Miller was believed to live a transient lifestyle, and could have traveled between Vancouver, BC, Merritt, BC, California, USA, and possibly as far as Australia.

Case reference: 2012003199.CaseDesc: In 1982, Lance Kunderman, age 22, left his home in Waterloo Region and headed to Banff, Alberta. Lance was reportedly in British Columbia in October 1982 and was to travel abroad. He was working with singer Eric Clapton's road crew. On December 26, 1982 Lance spoke with his family saying he was still with the band. Information was that Lance worked between Los Angeles and Vancouver. He was last seen in Vancouver, British Columbia in October 1982.

Scar: Genitals, may have a surgical scar from a twisted testicle operation

Case reference: 2006017499.CaseDesc: Michael McIntyre was last seen on April 7, 1994 at his home on Round Lake in Hagarty Township, approximately 10 km northwest of Killaloe, On. An extensive land search and follow up to leads have proved negative. Mr. McIntyre is formerly from Fort McMurray, Alberta. He came to live in Round Lake in December of 1993. He is an avid outdoor sportsman.

Case reference: 2014005809.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2012, Martha Kelly was last seen walking near her residence in Perth Andover, New-Brunswick. Martha suffered a brain injury in the past, leaving her at times with short term memory problems. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018040713.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1996, at approximately 7:30am, William Chan was last seen when he dropped off his son at school in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Ski coat; Brand-North Face

Case reference: 2013000061.CaseDesc: In 1996, Amanda Bartlett was living in Winnipeg, having previously resided in both Saskatoon and The Pas. Amanda was last seen by a family member at the intersection of Selkirk Ave. and Salter St. in late July, 1996. Amanda has not been seen or heard from since that time.

Case reference: 2012020029.CaseDesc: Julie Derouin was reported missing to Lethbridge Police in June of 1983. There have been no confirmed sightings of Julie since January 1, 1980. Police investigations continue.

Case reference: 2014001190.CaseDesc: In June, 1997, the body of a male was found floating in Malpeque Harbour, Prince Edward Island. The man was buried without ever having been identified. In 2010 the remains were exhumed so that a facial approximation could be completed by a forensic artist. Subsequent media publicity has failed to identify the man. His physical descriptors do not match missing persons from the Atlantic Canada region.

Case reference: 2012020015.CaseDesc: Veronica Lem was reported missing on June 11, 2009 from Richmond, BC. She missed a flight from the Vancouver International Airport to Toronto, Ontario. Miss Lem may suffer from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2014002572.CaseDesc: André Demange was last seen on September 2, 1983, in Montreal, Quebec. André's personal effects were found a few days later near the water close to Des Ormeaux and Bellerive street.

Case reference: 2014001164.CaseDesc: On June 29, 2005, a man was found in the St. Lawrence River at 333 of the Commune (near the Old Port Clock). The man had a Egyptian cross pendant that he wore at his waist.

Jewelry: Metal, pendant of an Egyptian cross

Case reference: 2014001078.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1991, the body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 30-49 was found in the Louisbourg Park in the Cartierville district of Montreal, Quebec.  The man's face was severely disfigured. A forensic artist has completed a facial reconstruction of his features.

Case reference: 2012020127.CaseDesc: Jocelyne Dubé, 57, was last seen on October 2nd 2008. On the night of her disappearance, she received a phone call from a friend and a visit from her daughter at her Piedmont, Quebec residence.  A few days after the disappearance, her abandoned vehicle was found in Montreal, Quebec. Everything indicates that the car had been there for a few days.

Case reference: 2017060465.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2017, Jesse Clint Galganov was seen for the last time when he took a flight to Peru from the Montréal-Pierre-Elliott Trudeau Airport in Montreal, Quebec. On September 28, 2017, Jesse contacted his mother to tell her that he was going to go hiking for a few days in the forest. Since this time, Jesse has not been seen nor has he contacted his family to provide them with his whereabouts which is contrary to his habits.

Shoes: Black, White, Running shoes with white soles

Case reference: 2012020646.CaseDesc: Antonie Medzech was last seen outside the Midtown Plaza in downtown Saskatoon, SK at approximately 8:00 a.m. on December 13, 2002. Mrs. Medzech had been dropped off at that location to go shopping.

Jewelry: Leather, Watch, silver face, black strap

Case reference: 2012020119.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1989, Francois Willey was seen for the last time in Chateauguay, Quebec. François has not been seen or heard from since.

Mark: Front Of Neck, Birthmark under Adam’s apple

Case reference: 2014004667.CaseDesc: The Gypsumville RCMP detachment received a report that an aircraft was in distress over Lake Winnipeg near Reindeer Island. The aircraft, a single engine Cherokee 140, had three people on board; the pilot and two passengers. The pilot had indicated that the engine had seized and that he was trying to make it to Reindeer Island. He then stated that he was going down in to the water. Two RCMP Twin Otters and an Air Search and Rescue Hercules conducted a search by air. It was not possible to search the lake by boat as there was too much ice on the lake. All three are presumed dead due to drowning or from the impact of the crash.

Case reference: 2018005122.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2018, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Balwant Singh was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Balwant was visiting Canada and failed to board his returning flight on January 29 at 6:00 p.m.

Case reference: 2013000047.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2000, Gianfranco Ferrara was for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. He had an appointment in the east end of Montreal but he never showed up.

Case reference: 2014002914.CaseDesc: Edward Allan Street was last seen at his rooming house on Columbia St in Kamloops, BC.  At around 8:30 am on March 4, 2000, Edward told his friends that he was quickly dropping by his place of work but would be back in time for a meeting at 10:00 am.  His wallet and ID were left inside his room.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Foot, Broken foot as a child
Amputation: Right Ring Finger, Amputated at 1st knuckle
Right Middle Finger, Amputated at 1st knuckle

Case reference: 2014011272.CaseDesc: During the morning of June 10, 2014, Yvonne Wallace left her residence. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020003.CaseDesc: Kelly Rideout was reported missing to Chilliwack RCMP on August 28, 2011.  She is believed to have lived a high risk life style and her disappearance is suspicious.  Police believe that Miss Rideout was the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2013000112.CaseDesc: On March 14, 2012, a male was found in a densely wooded area to the north east of the junction of Winchester Road and Ritson Road, in Oshawa, Ontario. His appendix was present. It is believed he had been there from a few days to a few weeks.

Hair: Brown, Short, Shorter than collar length; few days growth of facial hair
Teeth: He had a full set of adult teeth with no restorations

Case reference: 2013000070.CaseDesc: On June 4, 1980, Serge Jobin was seen for the last time in the De Lorimier district of Montreal, Quebec. He may have taken a bus to New York City in the United States. Serge is hearing impaired and mute.

Case reference: 2014006098.CaseDesc: On March 12, 2012, Mr. Ménard left Quebec to travel to Mexico by car with his dog. When returning home on March 14, 2013, he was denied entry to the United States at the US Customs in Nuevo Laredo because his dog was carrying ticks. Therefore, he stayed in Mexico and has not been seen since. His vehicle and his dog were recovered after having been stolen. The individuals interviewed for the vehicle theft provided no information into Mr. Ménard's disappearance.

Case reference: 2016008144.CaseDesc: Ben Trommels was last seen at his residence after being dropped off at 6:00 p.m. on Thursday, February 11, 2016.  It is believed that he left his apartment on foot that evening.  Ben suffers from mental health issues.

Hair: Brown, often has a shaved head
Coat: Black, winter; with fur trimmed hood

Case reference: 2009001499.CaseDesc: Louis Riklik was last seen on October 12, 2008, in the Toronto area. On October 19, 2008, Mr. Riklik entered the Bruce Peninsula National Park. His vehicle, a blue 2003 Mazda minivan, was located at the Halfway Log Dump Road parking lot. This is an access point to the Bruce trail. An extensive ground, air and water search was conducted by the OPP, Mr. Riklik was not found.

Case reference: 2014003102.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1972, David Kyak was seen for the last time in Iqaluit, Nunavut.

Hat: Canvas, Blue, Ball cap, Polar bear crest

Case reference: 2005003599.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2002, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River near the Maid of the Mist dock in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem length was 5’5" and his weight was 114lbs., however, due to the condition of the body, this is an underestimate and he weighed more in life. It is estimated that he was in the water for weeks to months.

Teeth: Has an amalgam filling on his left lower first molar and poor dental hygiene

Case reference: 2014005961.CaseDesc: Chris Metallic had been attending a party at a residence in Sackville on Saturday night but was last seen in Sackville at approximately 3 a.m. on Sunday, November 25, 2012. A search for Mr. Metallic focused on a wooded area and river off of Route 940 heading toward Shemogue after information was received that a person was seen walking on the Upper Aboujagne Road around 5:30 a.m. on Sunday morning.

Deformity: Unknown, Crooked fingers on left hand

Case reference: 2020018574.CaseDesc: Steven WOYTOWICH is believed to be homeless and was last seen in the Beverly area of Edmonton, Alberta, in early March of 2020.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, lady on a mushroom

Case reference: 2015035404.CaseDesc: On the morning of June 27, 2015, Curtis Wilson was seen for the last time by a friend in Kelowna, British Columbia. Mr. Wilson had travelled from Alberta to British Columbia in a black rental car, model Chrysler 200. Subsequently, the rental was recovered in an area off Cosen Bay in the Kalamakla Provincial Park in Coldstream, British Columbia.

Shirt: Black, TSHIRT, Orange logo on front of shirt
Tattoo: Right Forearm, Skull in top hat 'Wicked'; skull outer forearm
Right Forearm, Skull with snake through it, $$ signs & flaming skull
Left Chest, Eagle head; upper chest
Left Forearm, Red & black scorpion on inside forearm
Right Upper Arm , Three skulls, inside bicep
Right Upper Arm , Skull, outside bicep

Case reference: 2014005893.CaseDesc: On September 23, 2012, Timothy Colbon was seen for the last time as he left a residence, without wearing any shoes, in Elk Lake, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Timothy had travelled with friends from London, Ontario to Elk Lake.

Case reference: 2012020120.CaseDesc: On October 19th 2003, Jeanne-D'Arc Asselin, 66, was to go to her boyfriend's but called to cancel at the last minute. Ms Asselin went to buy beer at the convenience store and was never seen again. She disappeared from Valleyfield. During the months prior to her disappearance, she seemed confused and had memory loss. Ms Asselin had suffered a stroke in the past.

Case reference: 2021044031.CaseDesc: David-Alexandre Beliveau was reported missing on September 27, 2021 and was last known to be in Calgary, Alberta on September 4, 2021. David has a number of unique tattoos on his hands, arm and back.

Case reference: 2014004403.CaseDesc: Ramona Shular was last seen in Fort St John, British Columbia at the end of November 2003.

Tattoo: Right Ankle, Red heart and rose
Mark: Mole in front of left ear
Scar: Right Eye, Scar from right eyebrow to cheek bone

Case reference: 2019065945.CaseDesc: On November 13, 2019, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Shane Kowerko was seen for the last time as he left a friend’s residence in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Shane did not tell his friend where he was going, and left his winter jacket there.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Girl holding baseball bat
Right Side Of Neck, Jiminy Cricket
Right Forearm, Chinese writing 5 characters (woman, word, name)

Case reference: 2013000063.CaseDesc: Pierre-Paul Proulx was reported missing to the Service de police de la Ville de Montreal on August 21, 2002. He was last seen in Montreal on August 8, 2002 when he left his apartment located in the Plateau du Mont-Royal district with his vehicle after receiving a phone call.

Pierce: Ears, Gold loop in left ear

Case reference: 2006008799.CaseDesc: Doris Fennell was last observed at the home of an acquaintace in Kitley-Elizabeth Township, near Addison, Ontario. Foul Play is strongly suspected in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014001103.CaseDesc: On June 26, 1990, an unidentified man was found in the whirlpool of the Niagara River. He had a muscular build, may have had mild emphysema and his appendix was present. He is believed to have been dead for at least 6 months.

Case reference: 2014004353.CaseDesc: On June 23, 2002 RCMP received a call reporting a missing person in the Village of Makinak. Reported missing was George Turnbull, 82 years old. George was last seen on June 22, 2002 at approximately 8:00 pm by a home care worker and was last spoken to on the phone by his son at approximately 10:00 pm that same day. The home care worker arrived at approximately 9:00 am on June 23, 2002 and noticed at that time George was not in his residence. At approximately 10:00 am the family began to search in and around the area of George's residence and farm yard. He suffers from mild dementia and has wandered off before. Volunteers continued to search for him until June 26, 2002 at which point the search was called off. George Turnbull was not seen again.

Case reference: 2014003161.CaseDesc: On February 4, 1985, Andrew Pasztor was reported missing in Richmond, British Columbia.  Andrew had left home with the family vehicle which was later found at a restaurant in North Vancouver.  Andrew has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Beige, Vinyl with imitation fur collar

Case reference: 2006015499.CaseDesc: Richard Ranger was last seen on March 4, 1999, at Buster's Confectionary on Main Street in Haileybury.  Richard had been admitted to the Temiskaming Hospital for psychiatric assessment the same day he went missing and may suffer from mental illness. His whereabouts are unknown and foul play is not suspected at this time.

Case reference: 2012020046.CaseDesc: On January, 17, 2008, Bradley Worobeck left his place of employment in downtown Calgary and went to a pub that was also in downtown Calgary. That was the last time anyone saw or heard from Bradley.

Case reference: 2016061073.CaseDesc: On July 13, 1980, the remains of a male was recovered from the Niagara River Whirlpool. His post-mortem length was measured at 5'9"; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he has been in the water for possibly 2 weeks.

Teeth: Has good teeth with several amalgam fillings of the molars.

Case reference: 2014004796.CaseDesc: Shirley Lee Cletheroe was last seen on June 9, 2006 in the Fort St. John area. She has had no contact with her friends or family since that date.

Case reference: 2015061728.CaseDesc: On the morning of January 25, 1967, Alphonse Brochu left his residence to deliver documents to a government agency in Ottawa, Ontario. That same day, Mr. Brochu’s vehicle was located on the Champlain Bridge, which connects Ottawa to Gatineau, Quebec.

Shoes: Black, Rubber on the toe area
Boots: Black, Rubber on the toe area
